Answers: for at whatever point you judge

Questions: rr every one of you who judges

Answers: you who pass judgment on someone else

Questions: esv: Therefore you have no excuse, O man, every one of you who judges.  For in passing judgment on another you condemn yourself, because you, the judge, practice the very same things.
Gk. for NIV's "a mere human being"
rr those who practice such things
esv: For in passing judgment on another you condemn yourself, because you, the judge, practice the very same things. We know that the judgment of God rightly falls on those who practice such things.

esv: We know that the judgment of God rightly falls on those who practice such things.  Do you suppose, O man- you who judge those who practice such things and yet do them yourself- that you will escape the judgment of God?

esv: Do you suppose, O man- you who judge those who practice such things and yet do them yourself- that you will escape the judgment of God? Or do you presume on the riches of his kindness and forbearance and patience,
esv: Or do you presume on the riches of his kindness and forbearance and patience, not knowing that God's kindness is meant to lead you to repentance?
rr your hard and impenitent heart
esv: not knowing that God's kindness is meant to lead you to repentance?  But because of your hard and impenitent heart you are storing up wrath for yourself
esv: But because of your hard and impenitent heart you are storing up wrath for yourself on the day of wrath when God's righteous judgment will be revealed.
rr He will render to each one according to his works:

Answers: repay each person, render to each one
what they have done, his works, his deeds

Questions: esv: on the day of wrath when God's righteous judgment will be revealed. He will render to each one according to his works:
rr to those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honor and immortality, he will give eternal life;
rr glory and honor and immortality
#rr tois men kath hupomon(ay)n (e)rgou (a)gathou d(o)xan k(ai)tim(ay)n kai aphthars(i)an zayt(ou)sin zow(ay)n ai(ow)nion
esv: He will render to each one according to his works:  to those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honor and immortality, he will give eternal life;
rr but for those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there will be wrath and fury.
#rr de tois de ex epith(ei)as kai apeith(ou)sit(ay) alayth(ei)a peithom(e)nois de tay adik(i)a org(ay) kai thum(o)s

esv: to those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honor and immortality, he will give eternal life; but for those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there will be wrath and fury.
rr There will be tribulation and distress for every human being who does evil, the Jew first and also the Greek,
#rr thl(i)psis kai stenockowr(i)a ep(i)pasan psuck(ay)n anthr(ow)pou tou katergazou(e)vou to kak(o)n, Ioud(ai)out e pr(ow)ton kai H(e)llaynos

esv: but for those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there will be wrath and fury. There will be tribulation and distress for every human being who does evil, the Jew first and also the Greek,
rr but glory and honor and peace for everyone who does good, the Jew first and also the Greek.
rr glory and honor and peace
#rr d(o)xa de kai tim(ay) kai eir(ay)nay pant(i) tow ergazou(e)now to agath(ow)n Ioud(ai)owte pr(ow)ton kai H(e)llayni

esv: There will be tribulation and distress for every human being who does evil, the Jew first and also the Greek, but glory and honor and peace for everyone who does good, the Jew first and also the Greek.
rr For God shows no partiality.
#rr ou gar estin prowsowpolaymps(i)a par(a) tow the(ow)
esv: but glory and honor and peace for everyone who does good, the Jew first and also the Greek. For God shows no partiality.
esv: For God shows no partiality. For all who have sinned without the law will also perish without the law
esv: For all who have sinned without the law will also perish without the law and all who have sinned under the law will be judged by the law.
esv: and all who have sinned under the law will be judged by the law. For it is not the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law who will be justified.
rr do not have the law
rr who do not have the law
esv: For it is not the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law who will be justified. For when Gentiles, who do not have the law, by nature do what the law requires
rr they do not have the law

Answers: law to themselves, law for themselves

Questions: esv: For when Gentiles, who do not have the law, by nature do what the law requires they are a law to themselves, even though they do not have the law.

Answers: work of the law, requirements of the law

Questions: esv: they are a law to themselves, even though they do not have the law. They show that the work of the law is written on their hearts,
esv: They show that the work of the law is written on their hearts, while their conscience also bears witness, and their conflicting thoughts accuse or even excuse them
esv: while their conscience also bears witness, and their conflicting thoughts accuse or even excuse them  on that day when, according to my gospel, God judges the secrets of men by Christ Jesus.
rr But if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast in God
esv:  on that day when, according to my gospel, God judges the secrets of men by Christ Jesus. But if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast in God
rr and know his will and approve what is excellent, because you are instructed from the law
esv: But if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast in God and know his will and approve what is excellent, because you are instructed from the law
rr and if you are sure that you yourself are a guide to the blind, a light to those who are in darkness
rr you are sure that you yourself
esv: and know his will and approve what is excellent, because you are instructed from the law and if you are sure that you yourself are a guide to the blind, a light to those who are in darkness
rr an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of children
esv: and if you are sure that you yourself are a guide to the blind, a light to those who are in darkness, an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of children
rr having in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth
esv: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of children, having in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth
rr you then who teach others, do you not teach yourself?
esv: having in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth you then who teach others, do you not teach yourself?
rr While you preach against stealing, do you steal?
esv: you then who teach others, do you not teach yourself? While you preach against stealing, do you steal?
rr You who say that one must not commit adultery, do you commit adultery?
esv: While you preach against stealing, do you steal? You who say that one must not commit adultery, do you commit adultery?
rr You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
esv: You who say that one must not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
rr You who boast in the law dishonor God by breaking the law.
esv: You who abhor idols, do you rob temples? You who boast in the law dishonor God by breaking the law.
rr For, as it is written, "The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.
esv: You who boast in the law dishonor God by breaking the law.  For, as it is written, "The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.
rr For circumcision indeed is of value if you obey the law,
rr if you obey the law
esv: For, as it is written, "The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.  For circumcision indeed is of value if you obey the law,
rr but if you break the law, your circumcision becomes uncircumcision.
rr if you break the law
esv:  For circumcision indeed is of value if you obey the law, but if you break the law, your circumcision becomes uncircumcision.
rr So, if a man who is uncircumcised keeps the precepts of the law,
rr a man who is uncircumcised
esv: but if you break the law, your circumcision becomes uncircumcision. So, if a man who is uncircumcised keeps the precepts of the law,
rr will not his uncircumcision be regarded as circumcision?
esv: So, if a man who is uncircumcised keeps the precepts of the law, will not his uncircumcision be regarded as circumcision?
rr Then he who is physically uncircumcised but keeps the law will condemn you
esv: will not his uncircumcision be regarded as circumcision? Then he who is physically uncircumcised but keeps the law will condemn you
rr who have the written code and circumcision but break the law.
esv: Then he who is physically uncircumcised but keeps the law will condemn you who have the written code and circumcision but break the law.
rr For no one is a Jew who is merely one outwardly,
rr no one is a Jew
esv: who have the written code and circumcision but break the law. For no one is a Jew who is merely one outwardly,
rr nor is circumcision outward and physical.
esv: For no one is a Jew who is merely one outwardly, nor is circumcision outward and physical.
rr But a Jew is one inwardly, and circumcision is a matter of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the letter.
rr a Jew is one inwardly
rr a matter of the heart
esv: nor is circumcision outward and physical. But a Jew is one inwardly, and circumcision is a matter of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the letter.
rr His praise is not from man but from God.
esv: But a Jew is one inwardly, and circumcision is a matter of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the letter. His praise is not from man but from God.
rr Then what advantage has the Jew? Or what is the value of circumcision?
rr Or whati s the value
esv: His praise is not from man but from God. Then what advantage has the Jew? Or what is the value of circumcision?
rr Much in every way. To begin with, the Jews were entrusted with the oracles of God.
esv: Then what advantage has the Jew? Or what is the value of circumcision? Much in every way. To begin with, the Jews were entrusted with the oracles of God.
rr What if some were unfaithful? Does their faithlessness nullify the faithfulness of God?
esv: Much in every way. To begin with, the Jews were entrusted with the oracles of God. What if some were unfaithful? Does their faithlessness nullify the faithfulness of God?
rr By no means! Let God be true though every one were a liar, as it is written,
esv: What if some were unfaithful? Does their faithlessness nullify the faithfulness of God? By no means! Let God be true though every one were a liar, as it is written,
rr That you may be justified in your words, and prevail when you are judged.
esv: By no means! Let God be true though every one were a liar, as it is written, That you may be justified in your words, and prevail when you are judged.
rr But if our unrighteousness serves to show the righteousness of God, what shall we say?
pick3: But if our unrighteousness serves to show ~the ~righteousness of God, what shall we say?
esv: That you may be justified in your words, and prevail when you are judged. But if our unrighteousness serves to show the righteousness of God, what shall we say?
pick3: That God is unrighteous to inflict wrath on us? (I speak in a human way.)
rr I speak in a human way
esv: But if our unrighteousness serves to show the righteousness of God, what shall we say? That God is unrighteous to inflict wrath on us? (I speak in a human way.)
rr By no means! For then how could God judge the world?
esv: That God is unrighteous to inflict wrath on us? (I speak in a human way.) By no means! For then how could God judge the world?
rr But if through my lie God's truth abounds to his glory, why am I still being condemned as a sinner?
esv: By no means! For then how could God judge the world? But if through my lie God's truth abounds to his glory, why am I still being condemned as a sinner?
rr And why not do evil that good may come? as some people slanderously charge us with saying.
esv: But if through my lie God's truth abounds to his glory, why am I still being condemned as a sinner? And why not do evil that good may come? as some people slanderously charge us with saying.
esv: And why not do evil that good may come? as some people slanderously charge us with saying. Their condemnation is just.
rr Why do you judge your brother? Or why do you despise your brother?
rr For we will all stand before the judgment seat of God
rr So then each of us will give an account of himself to God
James_Ref: You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone
esv: You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone
rr For we hold that one is justified by faith apart from works of the law.
esv: For we hold that one is justified by faith apart from works of the law.
